name: Deep Breathing
description: A basic breathing exercise to calm the mind.
posture: Sit comfortably with your back straight.
steps: Inhale slowly through your nose for 4 seconds.
Exhale slowly through your mouth for 4 seconds.

name: Box Breathing
description: A structured breathing method to calm your nervous system.
posture: Sit upright or lie down comfortably.

name: 4-7-8 Breathing
description: A calming technique to reduce anxiety and help with sleep.
posture: Sit or lie down in a relaxed position.
steps: Inhale through the nose for 4 seconds.
Exhale through the mouth for 8 seconds.

name: Alternate Nostril Breathing
description: Balances energy and calms the nervous system.
posture: Sit in a cross-legged position with a straight spine.
steps: Use right thumb to close right nostril, inhale through left.
Close left nostril, exhale through right.
Inhale through right, then exhale through left.

name: Pursed Lip Breathing
description: Helps slow your breathing and relieve shortness of breath.
posture: Sit or lie down comfortably.
steps: Inhale slowly through your nose for 2 seconds.
Purse your lips as if whistling.
Exhale slowly through pursed lips for 4 seconds.

name: Lion’s Breath
description: Releases tension and stimulates the throat chakra.
posture: Sit in a kneeling or cross-legged posture.
steps: Exhale forcefully through the mouth, sticking out the tongue.

name: Resonant Breathing
description: Breathe at a rate of 5-6 breaths per minute.
posture: Sit or lie down in a comfortable position.

name: Sama Vritti (Equal Breathing)
description: Balances the nervous system through equal inhales and exhales.
posture: Sit in a quiet place with an upright posture.
steps: Inhale through the nose for 4 seconds.
Exhale through the nose for 4 seconds.
Keep the breath smooth and even.

name: Ocean Breath (Ujjayi)
description: Creates a gentle sound by constricting the throat.
posture: Sit upright with a relaxed jaw.
steps: Inhale through the nose while slightly constricting the throat.
Exhale with the same throat contraction, producing an ocean sound.

name: Kapalabhati
description: A yogic breathing technique that energizes the body.
posture: Sit with your spine straight and shoulders relaxed.
steps: Forcefully exhale through the nose while pulling the belly in.
Repeat 30 times, rest, then repeat for 3 rounds.

name: Mindfulness Meditation
description: Stay present by focusing on your breath and sensations.
posture: Sit with a straight back and eyes gently closed.
steps: Bring your attention to the breath.
Notice thoughts as they come and go.
Gently bring focus back to the breath.

name: Body Scan Meditation
description: Guided meditation to increase body awareness.
posture: Lie down or sit comfortably with eyes closed.
steps: Focus on your toes and notice any sensations.
Move attention slowly upward through your body.
Release tension as you scan each area.
End the scan at the top of your head.

name: Loving-Kindness Meditation
description: Send goodwill to yourself and others.
posture: Sit upright in a quiet place.
steps: Silently repeat phrases of goodwill toward yourself.
Extend those wishes to others in widening circles.
Feel the warmth and connection grow.

name: Walking Meditation
description: Mindfully walk to sync your breath with movement.
posture: Walk slowly in a quiet area.
steps: Bring attention to the lifting and placing of your feet.
Keep your gaze soft and focused.

name: Zen Meditation (Zazen)
description: Focus on the posture and breath to build awareness.
posture: Sit cross-legged with a straight back and eyes half-closed.
steps: Focus on breath or sit in open awareness.
Let thoughts come and go without reacting.

name: Chakra Meditation
description: Balance energy centers through visualization.
posture: Sit comfortably and close your eyes.
steps: Visualize each chakra, starting from the root.

name: Mantra Meditation
description: Repeat a calming word or phrase to focus the mind.
posture: Sit with your back straight and eyes closed.

name: Transcendental Meditation
description: Use a personal mantra to reach a state of restful alertness.
posture: Sit comfortably with eyes closed.
steps: Return to the mantra when distracted.

name: Guided Imagery
description: Use visualization to relax your mind and body.
posture: Sit or lie down comfortably with eyes closed.

name: Breath Awareness Meditation
description: Focus only on the sensation of breathing.
posture: Sit upright with closed eyes.
steps: Bring full attention to your breath.
